isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE SPEED AXLES: SPICER D135-S, F155-S, F170-S SERIES - DESCRIPTION - PINION ABOVE CENTER APPLICATIONS

svcproc.title: PINION ABOVE CENTER APPLICATIONS
svcproc.para: The D135-S, F155-S, and F170-S axle assemblies may be specified for pinion above center applications, such as motor homes, buses, or other rear engine chassis vehicles.
The following modifications to the carrier assemblies have been made to insure proper lubrication when the axle assembly is mounted with the pinion above center.

Changes to the D135-S, for above center applications, are the addition of an oil scoop ( Figure 5), and an additional oil passage in the pinion bearing cage. The mounting screw for the oil scoop must be cleaned and coated with #271 Loctite or equivalent. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICANTS AND SEALERS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Changes to the F155-S and the F170-S, for above center applications, are the addition of two oil scoops ( Figure 6), and an additional oil passage in the pinion bearing cage. The mounting screws for the oil scoops must be cleaned and coated with #271 Loctite or equivalent. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICANTS AND SEALERS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. The 3/8 inch oil scoop mounting bolts must be tightened to 34 to 38 ft-lbs. (46 to 51 N•m).
